parts.text:
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate.  It promotes an event discussing social media and violence, featuring a speaker and moderator. There is no mention of any political candidate or party.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, promoting a public event. It is clearly intended to reach a wide audience, not just specific individuals.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to promote an academic event discussing the relationship between social media and violence. While the topic touches upon political effects, the event itself is not designed to influence votes in the parliamentary elections. The content focuses on academic discussion and research, not electoral campaigning.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post can be considered journalistic in nature, as it announces a public lecture on a relevant social and political topic. The description of the event and the speaker's credentials are presented in an informative manner, similar to a news article announcing an upcoming event.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post does not express personal opinions; it presents factual information about an event.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>2089681684818060</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes an academic event discussing social media and violence.  The event features a speaker and moderator, but there is no mention of any political candidate or party. The post's objective is to promote attendance at the event, not to influence votes in the parliamentary elections. The content is informative and journalistic in nature, announcing a public lecture on a relevant social and political topic.  Therefore, it does not meet the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006 and Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>MCC</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
